topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/539f435f6368723d19590000#post_539f435f6368723d19590000
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/539f42016368723efa000000#post_539f42016368723efa000000
The internet is, paradoxically, the smartest and dumbest place ever.[/bq]
Most of the stupidity on the internet is cause of new comers realizing they can post anonymously and thus can get away with not having to think before they say something.

On the plus side/down side in ten years the current group of stupid people will have grown up and realized that just cause it's on the internet doesn't mean it's true and/or that just cause your name isn't attached to your account doesn't mean you don't have to worry about quality posting.

On the plus side/down side in ten years we'll have a whole new group of people from developing countries getting internet access for the first time and thus acting stupid on it (cough) how saudi arabia wants to ban women from the internet (cough)

"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/539f46b7636872789b500000#post_539f46b7636872789b500000
Corkscrew penises that can apparently rocket out at high speeds, if I remember that joke nature video right.

But I guess it's just that nature is mostly a jerk to its own self - when it comes to humans, they're either too scared into submission to do any _really_ weird stuff (unless you figure in some primates and the like ==*shudders*==), or they get trained and hopeful that they'll receive a reward of some kind for good behavior.

topics.body:
I watched Frozen last week on a plane. Good, but overrated. Can't stand the music and my opinion on Olaf is honestly in-between the initial reaction and the final reaction, but goddamn the animation is beautiful and look at the way Elsa struts!

Edit: I actually could not stand "Let it go" because of it's omniprescence.

topics.body:
"@NotYourAverageLurker":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/539f4d726368724e632f0100#post_539f4d726368724e632f0100
I haven't even watched the movie. And I'm already getting ticked of the "Let It Go' song being played just about *everywhere*. One reason why I despise Disney, they drown out everything.

People may get pissed at us Pony fans for appearing everywhere on the internet. But we are mostly on the internet, but in not every bloody outlets of life. Though, I'd wish Ponies would take over every aspects of people's lives and become society's law. But it just a pipe dream.
